data.title: Coinbase Scoops 2,772 BTC in Q3, Profits Surpass Wall Street Estimates
data.description:
Coinbase reported a net income of $432. 6 million for Q3 2025, surpassing Wall Street analysts' estimates, increasing fivefold from $75. 5 million last year.
source: https://cryptonews.com/news/coinbase-scoops-2772-btc-in-q3-profits-surpass-wall-street-estimates/

data.title: Bitcoin mining company Core Scientific's $9 billion acquisition plan to acquire CoreWeave has stalled due to shareholder failure.
data.description: Bitcoin mining company Core Scientific failed to secure approval for its merger plan with AI infrastructure company CoreWeave at its shareholder meeting on Thursday. The company stated that the final vote result will be disclosed in a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Friday. Under the previously announced acquisition terms, CoreWeave plans to acquire Core Scientific at a valuation of approximately $9 billion, with shareholders receiving shares at a ratio of 0.1235 CoreWeave Class A ordinary shares for every Core Scientific share. However, several shareholders have questioned the valuation of the deal, arguing that the acquisition price significantly undervalues ​​the company. Two Seas Capital, the largest active shareholder, stated in August that the deal “seriously undervalues ​​the company and exposes shareholders to unnecessary financial risks.” Following the announcement, Core Scientific's stock price fell more than 5% on Thursday. This deal, which has garnered significant attention since last year, is seen as a landmark event in the increasing convergence of the Bitcoin mining industry and the field of artificial intelligence. (Cointelegraph)

data.title: Hong Kong Appoints Stablecoin Review Tribunal for Regulatory Oversight
data.description:
Hong Kong announces officials for Stablecoin Review Tribunal to oversee digital asset regulations.

data.title: sUSDD TVL officially surpasses $30 million, with a stable 12% APY return.
data.description: On October 30th, the official USDD website announced that the TVL (TVL) of its yield-generating token, sUSDD, has officially surpassed $30 million. This achievement highlights the trust and support from the community and is also attributed to sUSDD's stable 12% APY. Through the Smart Allocator mechanism, sUSDD delivers sustainable and real-world returns, allowing users to enjoy transparent rewards without complex operations. sUSDD is a yield-enhanced version of USDD and has been deployed on TRON, Ethereum, and BNB Chain. Since its launch on October 6th, its TVL has surged to $30 million in less than a month, further demonstrating its strong appeal in the DeFi space. The USDD team stated, "This is just the beginning. We will continue to drive multi-chain growth and innovation, and we thank the community for their trust and participation."

data.title: Ether.Fi Community Proposes Treasury Fund Allocation for ETHFI Buyback
data.description:
According to Odaily, the Ether.Fi community has proposed a plan to allocate treasury funds for an ETHFI token buyback initiative. The proposal seeks to authorize the foundation to use treasury funds to repurchase ETHFI tokens when their market price falls below $3, with a total buyback amount capped at $50 million. The objective is to accumulate ETHFI tokens when prices are low and to increase the proportion of protocol revenue allocated for buybacks.

The buyback will commence immediately following DAO approval and will continue until one of the following conditions is met: the maximum amount is reached, the foundation deems the plan complete, or subsequent governance votes modify or terminate the plan.

The next step involves a four-day voting period on Snapshot. Once approved, the buyback plan will be activated as soon as the price conditions are met.

data.title: Liquid Capital Founder Discusses Cryptocurrency Investment Strategies
data.description: According to Odaily, Liquid Capital founder Yi Lihua shared insights on the X platform regarding cryptocurrency investment strategies. He addressed inquiries about the accuracy of timing market bottoms and tops, explaining that the process is not as flawless as it may seem. Yi Lihua recounted his experience with Ethereum (ETH), noting that when ETH fell to $1,800, he began buying, but the price continued to drop to $1,350, causing concern. The subsequent rebound to $1,450 prompted further analysis and reports at $1,750. When ETH reached $2,700, a Middle Eastern geopolitical event led to a correction down to $2,100, resulting in widespread criticism. Yi Lihua mentioned that he reduced leverage too early when ETH surpassed $3,000 and sold holdings around $4,500 instead of waiting for $4,900. He emphasized that while no one can be entirely accurate, following the correct trend can prevent fatal mistakes. He concluded by stating that buying is ultimately for selling, and selling is for buying.

data.title: Michael Saylor: Strategy has no plans to acquire other Bitcoin treasury companies at present.
data.description: Strategy Chairman Michael Saylor stated during the company's third-quarter earnings call that while future acquisitions are not ruled out, the company currently has little interest in acquiring other Bitcoin treasury companies. He pointed out that mergers and acquisitions are often accompanied by numerous uncertainties and typically take six to nine months or even longer to complete. "An idea that seems good at first may no longer be suitable after six months." Saylor added that the company currently has no plans to pursue such acquisitions, even if they appear to offer potential for added value. (Cointelegraph)

data.title: Michael Saylor Expresses Caution on Bitcoin Treasury Acquisitions
data.description: According to Odaily, Michael Saylor, Chairman of Strategy, stated during the company's third-quarter earnings call that while future acquisitions of other Bitcoin treasury companies are not ruled out, the company currently has little interest in such endeavors. He highlighted that mergers and acquisitions often involve numerous uncertainties and can take six to nine months or even longer to complete. Saylor noted that what initially seems like a good idea may no longer be suitable after half a year. He added that the company has no current plans to pursue such acquisitions, even if they appear to have potential for added value.

data.title: After a three-month hiatus, a whale withdrew 9,000 ETH from Bitget, worth $34.66 million.
data.description: Onchain Lens monitoring shows that a whale withdrew 9,000 ETH, worth $34.66 million, from Bitget after a three-month period of inactivity. This whale also has 15,127 ETH, worth $58.4 million, staked on Lido.

data.title: Arc releases list of the first 11 projects built on its public testnet.
data.description: Circle L1 blockchain Arc has released its initial list of 11 projects building on its public testnet. These include ZKP2P (an on-chain stablecoin protocol), Sequence (a general-purpose crypto trading platform), Superface (a smart agent solution interconnection platform), Blockradar (a stablecoin wallet infrastructure), Copperx (a stablecoin banking service), Crossmint (a crypto API development company), Hurupay (a cross-border fund transfer and management program), Para (a wallet infrastructure), CFi (a personalized finance platform), Hinkal (a zero-knowledge proof-based wallet), and Axelar Network (a cross-chain infrastructure).

data.title: Coinbase CEO: Bullish on BTC, company will continue to increase holdings.
data.description: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong posted on the X platform that Coinbase is bullish on Bitcoin, with the company increasing its Bitcoin holdings by 2,772 in the third quarter and continuing to increase its Bitcoin holdings.

data.title: Nordic bank that once shunned crypto to soon offer a Bitcoin ETP

data.description:

data.title: BitMEX launches ZEC and XMR contract trading, supporting leverage up to 33x.
data.description: BitMEX announced the launch of Zcash (ZEC) and Moreno (XMR) contract trading, supporting leverage up to 33x.

data.title: Binance will adjust the cross-margin collateral ratio on November 7th and 14th.
data.description: According to an official announcement, Binance will adjust the collateral ratios for multiple assets under its cross-margin leverage model in two batches, at 06:00 (UTC) on November 7, 2025 and 06:00 (UTC) on November 14, 2025. This involves dozens of tokens including WIF, JTO, OP, VET, and NEIRO. The adjustment is expected to last approximately 30 minutes. Users should closely monitor their margin levels to avoid potential liquidation risks. (This news item was generated with AI assistance.)

data.title: Strategy Transfers Significant Bitcoin Holdings to New Wallets
data.description: According to PANews, monitoring by Lookonchain has revealed that Strategy has transferred 22,704 BTC, valued at $2.45 billion, to several new wallets over the past nine hours.

data.title: Polymarket predicts an 89% probability that "the US version of Polymarket will launch in 2025".
data.description: Data from the Polymarket platform shows that the probability of predicting "Polymarket's US version will launch in 2025" has reached 89%, with the total prize pool currently exceeding $5.53 million. Previously, influenced by news of "Polymarket's $112 million acquisition of the compliant US exchange QCX," the probability of this bet rose to 98.8% before falling back to a low of 78.8%. According to TheBlock, Polymarket will return to the US by the end of November, after which it will launch and airdrop the POLY token.
